_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Vital conditions for spiritual progress: An unethical person destroys a vital condition for having no regrets
One who has regrets destroys a vital condition for joy
One who lacks joy destroys a vital condition for rapture
One who lacks rapture destroys a vital condition for tranquility
One who lacks tranquility destroys a vital condition for bliss
One who lacks bliss destroys a vital condition for right immersion
One who lacks right immersion destroys a vital condition for true knowledge and vision
One who lacks true knowledge and vision destroys a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion
One who lacks disillusionment and dispassion destroys a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom
The fulfillment of vital conditions for: An ethical person fulfills a vital condition for not having regrets
One who has no regrets fulfills a vital condition for joy
One who has fulfilled joy fulfills a vital condition for rapture
One who has fulfilled rapture fulfills a vital condition for tranquility
One who has fulfilled tranquility fulfills a vital condition for bliss
One who has fulfilled bliss fulfills a vital condition for right immersion
One who has fulfilled right immersion fulfills a vital condition for true knowledge and vision
One who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision fulfills a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion
One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion fulfills a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom
